headline.main: OFFICER DEPICTS SINKING OF WASP; Tells Here How Carrier's Fate Was Decided 30 Seconds After First Torpedo Hit

lead_paragraph: The marines at Tulagi Harbor and Henderson Field have piled up 22,000 tons of Japanese scrap, it was estimated here yesterday by Lieutenant A.J. Tucker, U.S.N.R., who was in command of underwater stabilization aboard the aircraft carrier Wasp when she was sunk in the battle for the Solomon Islands.
abstract: Lt A J Tucker depicts US carrier Wasp sinking
